title: Did San Francisco Vote to Remove ‘Washington,’ ‘Lincoln’ from School Names?
subtitle: The effort was initiated by officials who aimed to “dismantle symbols of racism and white supremacy culture.”
author: Madison Dapcevich
vclaim: In January 2021, the San Francisco Board of Education passed a resolution aimed at removing the names of George Washington, Abraham Lincoln, and other notable public figures from schools in the San Francisco Unified School District.
